channel.title: Birds fall from the sky again, and another Earthquake in Japan
channel.description:
What a way to start 2012, its a sign, another year closer.
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2080859/Blackbird-deaths-Sign-apocalypse-thousands-die-2nd-New-Years-Eve-row.html
http://www.reuters.com/article/2012/01/01/us-japan-earthquake-idUSTRE80003020120101

item.title: Birds fall from the sky again, and another Earthquake in Japan
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:12, topic:427680”]I stopped reading after:

Ancient Mayan legend says that 2012 will bring the end of the world.

because thats just not true.[/quote]

Exactly. It stems from the notion that time is cyclical, not linear. Mayans didn’t even believe the world ends in 2012, it’s just the start of a new cycle. Didn’t even notice that it was mentioned in the article.

http://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/2011-01-05-arkansas-dead-birds-fireworks_N.htm

Read full topic

item.title: Birds fall from the sky again, and another Earthquake in Japan
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

it’s not uncommon for a large number of birds or fish to suddenly die, they all eat and live together so a single environmental factor could take them out quite easily

come back when a large number of dogs or cats or something die

also did we forget shit like birdflu exists? :o

Read full topic
item.source: Birds fall from the sky again, and another Earthquake in Japan

item.title: Birds fall from the sky again, and another Earthquake in Japan
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Given the amount of birds and the condensed time and location of their deaths, there has to be some commonality behind the bizarre event, but scientists remain baffled.

A sentence like that makes me cringe. This is the reason a lot of morons see this as another sign of upcoming apocalypse. The way the media present this, makes it look like scientists are completely flabbergasted and hurrying to their bomb shelters. Scientists aren’t baffled, they just don’t have a conclusive answer yet. They have to test a big sample of birds before they can safely say this or that killed the birds.

Read full topic
item.source: Birds fall from the sky again, and another Earthquake in Japan

item.title: Birds fall from the sky again, and another Earthquake in Japan
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

What a way to start 2012, its a sign, another year closer.

Mail Online – 1 Jan 12

First sign of an apocalyptic year to come? Thousands of blackbirds fall to their...

Approximately 5,000 blackbirds dropped dead from the sky last night in the early hours of the new year in Beebe, Arkansas, and there is no clear reason why.

http://www.reuters.com/article/2012/01/01/us-japan-earthquake-idUSTRE80003020120101

Read full topic
